intro: Agatea veillonii, commonly known as the veillonii agatea, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in wetlands or along streambanks. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
